Reviews.Title: Sooo much better than the prevail!!
Reviews.Author: Chantelle Houston
Reviews.Content: I bought the prevail about 3 months ago, from Target. It was my first smartphone and I was in love with it. That is until I started borrowing my other friends smartphones and seeing how many apps they had installed. How?, I wondered. Well I found out that other phones came with much more internal memory installed, this being one of them. At first I was skeptical about purchasing this phone because there were no other reviews of it, but I am very happy that I did!!Pros:Front-facing camera -- I love this thing!! Skype finally works correctly!Large Screen -- The screen is so much larger than the prevail, and so much clearer!!Keyboard--Being an avid texter, I love the feeling of the keys under my fingertips!!1GHz Processing speed -- This is super fast!! My apps open up quicker, and the screens can slide so much easier!!Flash - Finally I can use all those LED flashlights on the market!Bloatware : It doesn't come pre-installed with the bloatware that the prevail did, like Hookt, and that weird game ScavGR, or whatever it was.Cons: Moving Icons : The only con I've found so far, is that when I am trying to move icons out of the drawer or across the screen, they seem to auto-stick into slots. Wish there was a setting to change this!!

Reviews.Title: Samsung Transform Ultra from a big man's perspective... who also modded his phone...
Reviews.Author: J. Tirelli
Reviews.Content: The Samsung Transform Ultra is a mid range phone but it performs very well for it's price range. I bought mine for $120.00 during a black friday sale and have been using it since then. I am a large man, I am 6'5" and I weigh in at 290 lbs (just lost 13 pounds last month woot woot!) I chose this phone over the warp because it has a qwerty keyboard and I am glad that I did. I do NOT enjoy using the touch screen keyboard.. The Qwerty keyboard works just fine for me, I don't ever fat finger any extra keys. In short I am in love with this phone and in this phone has caused me to love android.From a modders perspective this phone has an active community. There are at the time of this writing 4 custom roms, an over clock kernel, a recovery tool based on clockwork mods and a one click root tool. Cyanogenmod 7 is in the works and Cyanogenmod 9 is being talked about and worked on by one enterprising individual. Let me say that in clearer terms... this phone will likely have an ice cream sandwich based rom built for it. I would recommend this phone to anyone and everyone because as I have mentioned I am smitten with it.AnTuTu Benchmark with no tweaks 3532Highest Performance for this device 4695 (cpu clocked at 2016 Mhz)Specs:Qwerty KeypadARMv7 1 Ghz cpuAdreno (TM) 205 gpu370mb ram1gb onboard memoryCons:It has a touch screen issue where if you stop your finger while dragging something it forgets your finger is there. This is well documented and seems to affect all phones of this model. The modding community is currently working on a fix for this.Phone battery length is short, however I feel this is a con across all smart phones. The drain comes primarily from radio usage, I can turn off wifi and 3g while I am using it for a game or an ebook and it will last much longer. A battery extender app is a MUST. I use juice defender ultimate and get 2x battery life through location based wifi activation and turning off network connectivity (wifi and 3g) while screen is off, it checks in every 30 minutes for facebook updates etc. Heavy users should expect to charge this phone twice a day, giving it an afternoon nap charging and once again while you sleep. But when I say heavy I mean constant use like I do. If I use it only moderately I will go all day with one charge.

Reviews.Title: Love IT
Reviews.Author: scherry
Reviews.Content: I love the phone the more I play with it and use it.It is a great phone I got it promptly and appreciate the service.

Reviews.Title: A Great Phone w/Boost Mobile
Reviews.Author: Il-Rev
Reviews.Content: I was skeptic because I've never had an Android phone before, and I've read some reviews about a touchscreen problem that comes with this phone. I decided to get one anyways because the problem was small, and indeed it is.Overall, the phone is very enjoyable to use. Smooth interface, good sized touchscreen, width/weight is good, the slide keyboard is responsive and I really enjoy the feel of it (contrary to some of the other reviews posted here on Amazon). I guess it's a preference thing. In addition, I am a heavy user of this phone and I find the battery to be good actually (I am comparing this to a brand new i-pod touch, which has the lifespan of a headless rat, and I only use that for music). The battery is good, considering you download an app to manage your battery better (I use Juice Defender. Otherwise, it's moderate.With the positives come the negatives. The phone is a bit slippery in terms of grip, and although the back design is nice, this baby can slip n' slide miles away. The camera is simply not up to par with today's standards. Pictures are quite grainy. There is that touchscreen problem, but I am not affected by it at all.As for the Service being BoostMobile, it runs very well. I get service mostly everywhere, calls are clear (more clear than U.S. Cellulars from what I've experienced, 3G is fast, and a monthly shrinkage plan down to 35 bucks a month after 18 months is a pretty decent deal. That with no contracts, I will take it.

Reviews.Title: Great deal on a great phone
Reviews.Author: Una Nelson-White
Reviews.Content: I love this phone. Has a great slide out keyboard. If you use slide out keyboard all the time, you can turn off the screen keyboard to save on memory. Large screen and a great, detailed paper manual. The ID packs included are great. They include twitter and facebook, with a facebook gadget that shows your favorite friends latest wall posts. Boost mobile is a great flat rate deal a mouth, for everything. Unlimited calls, texts, emails and web.  It goes down in price every 6 mouths if you use auto pay. This is a good phone for someone who is new to texting, because the keyboard is much easier to use then on screen version.

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: jabronie03
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I had my doubts.  But this phone is truly a few steps up from most other phones offered by boost.  I just received the phone a few days ago, and have been fiddling with it since then.  I let the battery completely die after I initially turned on the phone.  Then I fully charged it.  This has seemed to help its performance.  It does take a while for the battery to fully charge but that is the only con I am seeing so far.I will write another review in a few weeks.

Reviews.Title: (Almost) Totally satisfied with my Transform Ultra
Reviews.Author: Richard J Byrne
Reviews.Content: I've been living with my new Samsung Transform Ultra from Boost for about 3 weeks now, and I have to say I love it. It's not perfect, but the things it does, it does very well. I'm an independent contractor and entirely dependent on my phone and laptop to make a living, so this was a key purchase for me.The highlight so far has been the processor speed and the capacity for apps and other storage. I had switched from a Blackberry Curve, and the improvement in speed was very noticeable. My Blackberry could not handle too many apps and the available selection was lacking. The Transform Ultra loads new apps quickly and they run great. The browser is plenty fast at 3G speed from Boost Mobile. I don't go to many graphics-heavy websites, so your mileage may vary on that. Boost has no 4G phones yet, which is odd because it is owned by Sprint, which seems to be the leader in 4G network at the moment. But this phone suits my purposes very well.A word about apps: Google, the Android proprietor, recently changed the name of the Android Market to Google Play, and reorganized it into 4 categories. This is fine, except that all but the most plugged-in of users appear not to know it as the launch has not been well promoted or announced. The changeover happened about a week after I got my phone, and I spent an afternoon fooling around with figuring out where my Android Market went. This is a marketing/support issue, though, and the new Google Play works as it should.Google did make it very easy to port over my contacts and calendar entries from my Blackberry via my Google account. I really was worried I'd have to re-key all my contacts when I switched from the BB platform to Android, but it was totally seamless.The size of my phone was important too. This one is a little smaller than most of its peers, even those from Samsung, like the Stratosphere. If you are bothered by the bulk of your current phone in your pocket, you should consider the Transform Ultra as it is a bit more compact.The slideout QWERTY keyboard is adequate, and getting a QWERTY keyboard was the main reason I chose the Transform Ultra. I do a lot of keying on my phone, both for emails and text messages, and have found that using the touchscreen to key is too difficult for a fat-fingered male like me. You ladies with your slender fingertips -- and in my girlfriend's case, long nails -- may not have as much of a problem with a touchscreen, but I kept making typos by hitting the wrong key, so for me, there is no substitute for a QWERTY keyboard.  If I can get on the soapbox for a moment, word has it that the cell phone industry as a whole is moving away from phones that offer a QWERTY keyboard, to more touchscreen-only devices. BIG mistake in my book.If you read around on the internet about the Transform Ultra, you may read a lot of negative remarks about the sensitivity or responsiveness of the touchscreen. I have to say I have experienced no problems with this. After a day or so of familiarizing myself with the inherent sensitivity of the device, I have had no errors or problems. My guess is those remarks came from folks who have become familiar with another device and have struggled with the transition. If you're thinking about buying a Transform Ultra, this isn't something I would let hold you back.I haven't used the camera much, but the photos I have taken are very good, at least as good as my Blackberry's. No complaints there.I will say there is one tradeoff that I am enduring with the Transform Ultra. Because of its smaller form factor, it has a 4-line keyboard, where competitors have 5. The top line contains all the numbers and requires use of the "function" key. This is a little inconvenient, and the clearance between the top line of keys and the slid-out chassis is tight. But this is the price you pay for having a phone that is a bit smaller in the pocket. I've played with a friend's Samsung Stratosphere, which has a 5-line keyboard, and it is a noticeably bigger phone overall.(Understand, too, that I am limited to what is available through Boost. I am wedded to the no-contract concept, and considered switching to another carrier, but I'm happy with Boost service, and if you want a better-than-average smartphone without a contract, they are the best deal going -- unlimited talk, text and data for $50 a month, which goes down to $40 with their "shrinkage" concept.)The only big downside of the Transform Ultra -- and you will hear about this from others -- is how slick the case is. This really was a hindrance when I first got the phone. It made it easily dropped, and it was even difficult to slide the phone open without using two hands. But the problem was easily conquered with a rubberized snap-on case that I bought on Amazon for under $5 -- which had the added bonus of making it harder to inadvertently launch the camera or change the speaker volume with the side keys. If you're buying a Transform Ultra, immediately order some kind of grippy case or cover.The package deal I purchased from Amazon included a nice leather (or is it synthetic? I can't tell) pouch that has both belt loops and a clip, and it works great with it's magnetic lid. The deal also included a car charger, which was a must for me, although my car stereo also has a USB port which, if you purchase a USB 2.0-to-USB-mini cord, you can also use to charge the phone on the run. Kudos to the seller for this package, which was delivered a day or two quicker than they told me it would be.

Reviews.Title: A Good Investment!
Reviews.Author: CGSandsJr
Reviews.Content: The phone is so sensitive that it will make calls that you didn't dail, but the more I used it the more I was able to control it. It has great features; however, depending on your service provider will depend on what you can do with it. I must acknowledge that this is the first smartphone I have owned, but I am having fun using it. The battery life could be longer, but I suspect that the next generation of phones will provide that. Each generation of phones seems to perform better and have better features; however, this phone can satisfy many of your needs. (Be patient & wait)

Reviews.Title: awesome product
Reviews.Author: zeebraynz
Reviews.Content: great product. i am satisfied with my purchase. great for music, web surfing, apps, and so much more. the only negative is that sometime i dont get good reception wtih boost and sometime the phone lags when apps are running causing the apps to force close sometimes. overall though i am happy with it. i would recommend it to anyone, but new phones are always on the rise so something better might be available too. so look around before.

Reviews.Title: happy
Reviews.Author: love
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with my phone. It looks brand new and had no marks on it. I have no problems with my phone.

Reviews.Title: Love the phone, but it was used.
Reviews.Author: Kay
Reviews.Content: I loveeeeee this phone and I'm very happy with this purchase but on the other hand I'm upset that the phone is used. When I went to boost mobile to set my phone account up with what I thought was my brand new phone, I found out that it was used. The only reason I was informed this was because the man setting up my account told me he can't set up insurance for a used phone. My phone came in the packing box like it was brand new so this was a shock and a disappointment for me. It claimed it was new when I puschased it, this is why I am only giving this 3stars. Other than that its a great phone and I'm very happy I decided to get it. Worth the money, and if I would of known it was used I would of went in store and brought it for full price.

Reviews.Title: Awesome phone!
Reviews.Author: Angel
Reviews.Content: Samsung for me has always been a favorite, because of the superior quality while on a contract.I've had the Samsung Galaxy S phones and loved the Epic before upgrading to the Galaxy S II touchscreen which is also an awesome phone.Then recently I left contracts behind and signed up for Boost Mobile, which do have great shrinkage plans!When I started out with Boost Mobile I'd bought a ZTE Warp, which is a nice phone for a touch screen, vivid colors, great sound quality but absolutely annoying swype on screen key pad.Now I have this phone and love it. The onscreen keypad had text prediction so you can choose which word to use, or not and the screen quality is vibrant. Calls on this phone are clear. It has a nice slide out keypad that is great for texting if you don't want to use the onscreen one.This phone reminds me so much of the Samsung Epic and I could not be happier.

Reviews.Title: Great phone.
Reviews.Author: RC
Reviews.Content: Earlier models of the Transform Ultra had infuriatingly bad touch-screens.  I'm glad I took another look, because it seems they fixed it newer batches, and mine works great.The horrible shell is slicker than a wet bar of soap, but there's a rubberized case that'll make it infinitely more gripable, and protected from drops.  Unfortunately it adds quite a bit of extra thickness, but I still call it a required accessory.The screen is lower-res than you'll see in top-rate smart phones, making apps take more real-estate and making smaller text in the main font unpleasant to read, but it's managable.  The screen is also closer to 4:3 than 16:9, which works better for some apps than others.The keyboard feels flat, doesn't have a nice raised texture to help you feel when your fingers are centered on a key, but I've gotten used-to it.  It's lacking several symbol keys I want to use frequently, instead having a "Sym" key that pops-up a menu.  But, infuriatingly, "less-than" and "greater-than" symbols are absent, making my frequent typing of quick HTML code painful, for no good reason.Still, even for all my complaints, I rate it pretty highly.  Its the only respectable Android phone on a prepaid provider, and thankfully it's a slider.  It'll run all your Android apps including Flash and Firefox, unlike other, equally inexpensive smart phones that skimp on the CPU.  There are exceedingly few apps that have issues.  The 2GB SD card is intolerably small, so another required accessory.Battery life is right on-par with other Android phones...  It'll last a day of light use, and maybe half a day of heavy use, but chargers are cheap enough to keep a couple extra in spots you frequent.

Reviews.Title: I love this phone!!!
Reviews.Author: Jalisa
Reviews.Content: i had the transform when it first come from $200 and I have fell in love with it first time i used it.So when i saw this online i didnt even think about it, i just ordered it and i love it still after 3 years of having this phone. Its simple unlike the other smartphone that are hard to control and it doesnt come with a bunch of apps so u have alot more internal memory unlike some smartphone that have all those apps you dont need and cant delete. If you are looking for something up to date and simple this is the phone for you. The seller of my phone was awesome, they get your packages to you in no time. They are nice and understanding and they gavc me extra pair of headphone so thank you for that.So overall i had a great experience with phone and seller of phone :) ;)Pros: keyboard and sleek and sexy little phone!!!Cons: it has a glass screen so not really durable but if you get a good case and screen protector you are good!!!only con for me!!!

Reviews.Title: camera freezes alot
Reviews.Author: courtney rogan
Reviews.Content: The camera keeps freezing along with the camcorder an I have to take out the battery to unfreeze it... smh

Reviews.Title: Great phone, still working fine after almost 3 years
Reviews.Author: RV
Reviews.Content: it's been almost 3 years since I got it and I'm still using it like the first day - the sliding keyboard works, the Z key requires extra attention but it did it from day 1, I upgraded the battery twice already with a bigger model that lasts 3 times as long so it easily gets me through the day (it came with a custom back and a wall charger) - the original USB cable ceased to function after about two years but I went on and got 3 similar ones for 2.99 each to go 1 with my phone, 2 with my car charger, 3 with my computer

Reviews.Title: Bad Business
Reviews.Author: nunu
Reviews.Content: The company that sold this phone to me never stated that it didn't work. They charge port on the phone was push sooo far back into the phone it was ridiculous..

Reviews.Title: Really good for price
Reviews.Author: Mariah
Reviews.Content: It's a really good phone & for the price .  It does everything I need to do camera is amazing . I love my phone : )

Reviews.Title: bad services
Reviews.Author: brittany
Reviews.Content: i got the phone the phone and the package its self was really damaged showed them a picture and they say i cant get a new one what is that

Reviews.Title: Great phone!
Reviews.Author: BC12407
Reviews.Content: My husband loves this phone! Plus we get to video chat!! It's a good size and has many good features including the slide out keypad. I do recommend this phone to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Had for a year.
Reviews.Author: Dana r.
Reviews.Content: Works great for being a low end android phone when it was purchased. It is on the Boost network (Sprint), which is something to consider. We had great reception when we lived near the city. Moved 40 minutes farther away and now we have to use it on the second floor of the house. That is not a knock on the phone. Just make sure you have good Sprint 3G coverage in your area before you purchase this phone.

Reviews.Title: MR.JOE A
Reviews.Author: Aamer avr avrahom razi
Reviews.Content: mr.joe a. the man of his honest words.i am very saidisfy with samsung ultraits a laptop hdtv in cell phone

Reviews.Title: Not good.
Reviews.Author: netta
Reviews.Content: Cant hear out the phone.Within a week everyone was saying they can't hear me talk. Now I have to use the speaker to talk.

Reviews.Title: new phone
Reviews.Author: Quadmani
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed receiving my brand new phone within the estimated time it was supposed to be sent out.  The only thing I didn't like which is why I didn't give it a 5star rating; was the fact the phone that was packaged the battery that came with it was already swollen (as though it had been in the sun amd immense heat) the swelling never went down but I had already ordered new batteries.  But as far as the functioning quality and everything else.  Awesome

Reviews.Title: Very good phone
Reviews.Author: Glenn Brown "Turning"
Reviews.Content: Very good phone at an excellent price! I had to return once but seller responded quickly.It costs 10 dollars extra for Boost mobile to put used/referbished phones on their network.Contacting a human at Boost is a hassle but here is a work aroud curtosey of GetHuman.com ([...])Call 888-266-7848When prompted to enter 10 digit # enter 10 zero's, it will take you to a live rep

Reviews.Title: I love this phone!
Reviews.Author: Savanna
Reviews.Content: I bought a refurbished phone and I am very happy with it. Although the battery life isn't very long, I love the keyboard and the android system. The delivery was great, I got it right on time. I am a klutz when it comes to phone's so I drop them often. This one has held up very well, even after being dropped in a puddle and in snow several times :/. It still works just fine and is quite durable in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Transform Ultra
Reviews.Author: litwhidov
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this phone to everyone I know. I love it! The only thing is I cant find screen protectors to fit it properly

Reviews.Title: 2nd (replacement for 1st one of same kind)
Reviews.Author: Anne
Reviews.Content: I did write to the seller of this item b/c the reason I bought this item was to replace the same one I bought less than 2 months prior.  Nothing but problems.  Conicidentally, we were trying to correct the problem with SamSung tech when the phone face shattered.  I paid avout $60 for the 1st one and $90 for the 2nd one.  When I called SamSung about the replacement of the face, they said $159.  That's just ridiculous especially since I filed a complaint weeks after having the product.  Not happy at all.  It was a gift and that's why I replaced it.  Hence, I ended up paying $150 anyway.

Reviews.Title: Great fast phone
Reviews.Author: anthony
Reviews.Content: This phone can open up web browser quickly and can download and open up apps less than 2 second. I just download 7 different apps in less than 2 minutes. video plays quickly on youtube with this phone. Its been a good experience with this phone so far!

Reviews.Title: I love this phone, but...
Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: So, this phone is great! I love it! but there's a problem.... after 6 months of owning it, well, it started going crazy.  It would start beeping, switching between screens by itself.  I did send it to samsung to get serviced for free, because it's still under warranty.  They had it for about 3 weeks, and now that i have it back, it's working.  It seems mine isn't the only one having the same problem.  my dad has the same phone and it's giving him the exact same problem.  If it wasn't for this problem i would give it 5 stars because i love all the features, especially the slide keyboard.

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted
Reviews.Author: Arika
Reviews.Content: Love the phone, I'm almost positive any issues I've had with it were because unfortunately I've dropped the phone so much... any advice would be to buy a case as well to help protect this awesome phone.

Reviews.Title: good phone
Reviews.Author: michael0810
Reviews.Content: only complaints are the slider mech is still stiff and ive had the phone for months.  and if you drop it even from waist hight  its almost guaranteed to lose its back cover and battery.

Reviews.Title: Looking for a New Phone "issues beware"
Reviews.Author: isabellayessi29
Reviews.Content: This phone was a gift and sadly almost one year with the phone and is flashing like it is charging and even when it isn't . I am very upset to leave this phone but, I will stay with the company and get a phone that will be waterproof or with a keyboard but diff a smart phone. I went to buy 2 battries thinking it was that and it wasn't, is something that is going cost me the same as a new phone , for this black friday, getting myself a new phone and hope this is the ONE that will last till my end of time.Con's.Last short time span, goes thru charging over 2 times a day if you use it even for texting , freezes on screen when you try touch screen something for games. It has this bogus and crazy thing that it goes black out. I have a very diffective phone and wonder why me .Proskey board, huge screen and easy keys to type .Don't get this phone if you have kids, because they will toss it and I think that is what has caused mines to have issues..I am going water proof this time I think or hide my phone from crazy kiddos.have fun phone shopping.

Reviews.Title: Best Phone Ever
Reviews.Author: JazzyJ
Reviews.Content: Samsung is a great brand so i knew i would b happy. i love my phone so much. i'm so glad i brought it on amazon. no complaints

Reviews.Title: Great phone for me
Reviews.Author: Joshua Vert
Reviews.Content: Battery life is very good. 3g uses a ton of juice. i suggest wifi when in range, but dont forget to turn it off when you're on the go.The qwerty keyboard is amazing and one of the best reasons to get this phone!The phone runs Android Éclair 2.1 OS, which runs pretty stable most of the time, only a few crashes in 6 months, usually with browser.Memory leaks? Have to keep deleting content to view pictures or load apps. recommend buying additional miniSD card that holds atleast 4gig

Reviews.Title: AllINeed
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: Luv this phone!!!! It has everything I need n the keypad is a definite plus... Android is my best friend Thanx

Reviews.Title: I JUST FELL IN LOVE HER NAME IS TRANSFORM ULTRA
Reviews.Author: C. Jones
Reviews.Content: This phone is a EXCELLENT buy. Defintely worth the money. Boost is a pretty good service provider. Just got this phone a month ago no problems just excellence. Awesome sleek look excellent feel every thing your looking for in an android phone. Processor perfect for the price range pretty smooth when changes pages.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Transform Ultra W/Car Charger-Like New
Reviews.Author: Tammie B.
Reviews.Content: Samsumg Transform With Car Charger/Wall Charger/SD Card/Boost/Box.Used/one Month-Great phone. Entered family plan with another service. Paid full price originally. Great phone & great service.

Reviews.Title: ok smartphone
Reviews.Author: Mark A. Joyeux "- YIP -"
Reviews.Content: I got two Transforms that had to be returned but only because they were "not" new.What I saw I liked for the most part. Web was fast....keyboard is a must for me but could be spaced better. Not great but still ok smartphone. Would buy again but this time...NEW.

Reviews.Title: 4 1/2 Starts
Reviews.Author: Shambo
Reviews.Content: I've been with Boost for four years now and love the service as much as AT&T; which gave me the same level of service for a much larger price.  I give this phone 4 1/2 stars.  I really like it so far.  The voice quality of calls are great and it has all the features I need and want.  The only negatives are that the keys are a little small so even with my small fingers, when typing I often hit multiple keys and have to correct this; also, I have to remember to hit the power button after I'm finished so that I don't accidently call someone or start an app.

Reviews.Title: Very, very satisfied customer!
Reviews.Author: Tiltawhirl
Reviews.Content: I love my new phone. It was very easy to set up and get familiar with. I have consumed hours of my life playing with this phone, seriously addicting and easy to navigate. I liked this phone so much that I bought one for my husband.I would highly recommend this phone to anyone who wants an iPhone, but doesn't want to pay a fortune for the phone and the service. Boost has never been a problem for me at all, no dropped calls, no waiting for texts or picture messages and the internet works very well on the go.The only problem I have with this phone is the camera. The shutter speed is SUPER SLOW, but I will sacrifice the camera for all the other things this phone has to offer.

Reviews.Title: the best!!!!
Reviews.Author: chris
Reviews.Content: This was the first new phone I want to get from boost and I had to get a different one but then I found this price for the phone and thought no way cuz in boost its 230 and I got this cell new and a car charger with a hip case for half the price and accessories then paying a lot in the store and only getting the phone ... I'm writing this review with the phone as we speak I really love it

Reviews.Title: Another Great Buy!
Reviews.Author: Jazz
Reviews.Content: I just received my Transform Ultra phone in the mail and it includes; the Samsung Transform Ultra with 2GB MicroSD, Lithium Ion Battery,the phone charger, Basic Guide & General Terms & Conditions booklets and came with a leather black case with a clip and two belt loops for more security also a Car charger. Came Brand New in the Package in Perfect condition. Using this phone I an say it's a lot better then the Warp, very happy about this buy. Arrived about 2-3 so fast can't remember. It's a good deal around where I live its around $200.00 after tax without the case and pone charger.

Reviews.Title: Samsung transform
Reviews.Author: gypsi rulez "Travellers"
Reviews.Content: My review of this phone is great....It arrived on time....Used but in excellent condition as posted...The package include car charger newHard case that's made for the phone (blue).  NewThe phone wrapped secured in a package of its own excellent condition....No sim  card shipped.Oh and wall charger new....Activate the phone ported my number great......Thanks no problem bugs or ticks....

Reviews.Title: a good buy
Reviews.Author: bill
Reviews.Content: the phone is pretty fast. the screen is a little buggy but it's still a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Carmen Vasquez
Reviews.Content: I love this phone. I am not really into technology, so I didn't want to buy something too fancy. For that reason, I decided to but this phone. It works perfectly well, I got it 2 days after I ordered it. Very satisfied with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: awesome new phone
Reviews.Author: Awilliams013
Reviews.Content: Phone is very nice,it does everything i need. I purchased because my samsung prevail, which i have only had for 8 months was not compat. with work email. so i needed to upgrade. and it does the trick. touchscreen is much more responsive than the prevail, and a little bigger screen is nice too. great price vs. the boost web site.

Reviews.Title: wrong phone
Reviews.Author: audreyh
Reviews.Content: I was sent the wrong phone company phone so I wasn't able to use this phone so now I'm back to square one

Reviews.Title: sending this phone back
Reviews.Author: Cyndee
Reviews.Content: My daughter has a medical condition - and I need my phone. This phone could hold a charge. I tried everything, looked online for solutions, had eveything turned off. For me this just wasn't relaible. I would take it off the charger, get in my car and 30 mins later it would die.  I'm going back to my old fashion phone that keeps a charge

Reviews.Title: my phone
Reviews.Author: dejonnai
